Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Bug]Fix potential overflow of statistics values." (#9128) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Add support for stats values up to max value of long.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Gallery] Determine whether more work is needed for optimizing secret refresh" (#8859) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Background

When the Gallery reads a secret, it will reload it if the current value is expired:

https://github.com/NuGet/ServerCommon/blob/92d2a66ef95a1772e748872d77f34a6e951ffdc8/src/NuGet.Services.KeyVault/CachingSecretReader.cs#L55-L64

This approach has a few problems:

1. It requires an asynchronous context to read secrets, even if secrets aren't expired. We have [synchronous hot paths that read secrets](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8858).
2. Concurrent accesses to the same secret results in the same secret being refreshed multiple times. This causes the thundering herd problem.

# Solution

The Gallery should reload secrets in the background and allow secrets to be read synchronously if possible. See:

* https://github.com/NuGet/ServerCommon/pull/363
* https://github.com/NuGet/ServerCommon/pull/363#issuecomment-807769173

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Make package body tabs linkable" (#8860) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. Read window hash param from url
2. Use passed hash to focus body tab
3. Replace window history on activate tab to
  - adjust current url (so you can copy and share it)
  - avoid navigating back through tabs


Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8822

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Unable to connect to NuGet - "...connection forcibly closed by the remote host"" (#9121) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Visual Studio 17.2.0, NuGet Package Manager 6.2.0

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

In Visual Studio 2022 Community Edition running on Windows Server 2012 R2, when I open the NuGet Package Manager UI, the Browse tab, after a few seconds, display "Error occurred" and the output window shows the following:

````
[nuget.org] Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
  An error occurred while sending the request.
  The underlying connection was closed: An unexpected error occurred on a send.
  Unable to read data from the transport connection: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.
  An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host
````

I get the same response if I try to install packages from the CLI. I follow the instructions in [this post](https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/60) to test connectivity and after running the test I get this response:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7631595/169079772-6a3eac2f-7054-4417-bb07-c4e6c35f7d8f.png)

Per that same post, I have verified that TLS1.2 is enabled on this machine and (to the best of my ability), that the following cipher suites are enabled on this machine:
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

I suspect you'll be unable to reproduce this issue as it's presumably specific to something in my configuration. I have been using Visual Studio on this machine for several years without this being an issue, but it suddenly started a few days ago. I have uninstalled and reinstalled Visual Studio, and subsequently run a Repair operation on it, both without success.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Sign in comes back with "Error 500 - Internal Server Error"" (#9126) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

After trying to sign in from the browser, the page goes to Error 500 - Internal Server Error
I have tried to 
- Clear cache
- Restart
- Try from another computer
- Try from a different browser

All of these attempts failed and navigates to Error 500 - Internal Server Error
I have confirmed that the user password is working as I tried with Microsoft Account and the same account is able to login other Microsoft services

### Repro Steps

Login to nuget.org

### Expected Behavior

Successfully able to log in and use the service

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10838987/170829497-dfecdaf3-b7c7-4122-bdd7-d284e967bc02.png)


### Additional Context and logs

With a full network log, I can share the username if required
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10838987/170829560-2b6ee0ba-2bf2-4cdf-be0b-b993c786475d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: 500 Server internal error when trying to login" (#9127) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

500 Server internal error when trying to login or to publish. Publish key should be valid and also the account.
I also created a new account just to be sure and same thing is happening. I used Edge and Firefox (also in private mode)
So this is happening with two separate accounts. One is older and the other is just created. 
Initially when the new account was created I was logged in but after sign out I just received Error 500 from Nuget.org (https://www.nuget.org/users/account/authenticate/return?ReturnUrl=%2F)
This is has been happening now for about couple of hours at least. Yesterday all worked just fine.
My ms accounts are working ok to other services (like Azure etc).

### Repro Steps

1. open https://www.nuget.org/
2. press Sign in
3. Select Sign in with Microsoft
4. Enter your credential and Sign in

### Expected Behavior

Expected to login normally nuget.org

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97743379/170830776-88cb002c-aa9e-4953-a30e-d77b61690fe5.png)


### Additional Context and logs

I also get 500 server error when trying to publish new packet version via nuget push to my account

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Proposal: Adding dotnet CLI support for projects onboarded to CPM" (#11849) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "[Bug]: GeneratePackageOnBuild doesn't allow setting the target framework for a tool separately from the project it is consumed in" (#11843) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

.net 5

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

I am writing a tool in .net and need to create a nuget package from it. This tool / nupkg is to be used from native C++ projects.
So the target framework for the tool itself is something like net5.0, whereas I need the nupkg to package the tool into tools/native.
I haven't found a way to do this; I am using `<PackAsTool>true</PackAsTool>` to get the system to pack it under tools, but that uses the TFM of the tool itself as if it is the TFM of the project that will reference the tool nuget. 
So I would need something like `<PackageTargetFramework>native</PackageTargetFramework>` but that doesn't exist, it would seem.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: dotnet list package report with definable column widths" (#11790) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

an option to specify the minimum width of the package name column in the list packages report

### Additional Context and Details

I would like to use the dotnet package list command to inspect all the packages in a project and compare the packages referenced between builds. I use this to monitor the changes to packages, especially transitive ones between builds. It would be very convenient if the column with was configurable so the layout didn't change depending on the length of the package names, then i wouldn't need to do any post processing on the file

originally posted here https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25159

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Get centrally-managed package versions via build properties" (#11847) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

In a similar way that MSBuild path properties can be generated for packages, it would be great if centrally-managed package versions could be made available as build properties.

### Additional Context and Details

I have a repository where one of the projects contains project templates for Visual Studio and `dotnet new`. At compile time for the templates project, I'd like to be able to perform some transforms on the templated csproj files so that I can automatically insert the centrally-managed package versions into the templated project files.

For example, say I'm using a centrally-managed version of 1.2.0 for OpenTelemetry. At compile time in the templates project, I might want to replace `<PackageReference Include="OpenTelemetry">` with `<PackageReference Include="OpenTelemetry" Version="1.2.0">` in each of the templated csproj files that will be in the templates package. If I had an auto-generated version property available (e.g. `PkgVersion_OpenTelemetry`) then this would greatly simplify things. This could be an opt-in behaviour specified on the `<PackageVersion/>` element e.g. `<PackageVersion Include="OpenTelemetry" Version="1.2.0" GenerateVersionProperty="true" />`.

I can make a workable solution right now by using a .props file to defined properties for the versions of packages used in the templated csproj and import that into both the template project and Directory.Packages.props, but in an ideal world I wouldn't have to define versions for some packages in a file other than Directory.Packages.props.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: dotnet nuget push not detecting apikey for 3rd party symbol server" (#11846) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

n/a

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Set apikey for `myget repo v3 index`. 
2. Create nupkg + snupkg.
3. Please do `dotnet nuget push .\somepackage.1.1.0.nupkg --source myget`
It doesn't detect apikey for 3rd party symbol server, not sure if it's myget implementation issue or `nuget.client` issue. It looks workaround is pass actual apikey as parameter in cli.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/171296532-6266e63e-2d71-4498-aa11-d3ae3ee1d637.png)
4. Also do `nuget push .\somepackage.1.1.0.nupkg -source myget` then it asks for username. 
 It looks workaround is pass actual apikey as parameter in cli.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/171297184-63415ecb-1e5b-4725-861c-c0db6c3d4ba0.png)




### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: dotnet nuget pack is missing create snupkg option" (#11845) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

n/a

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

For nuget.exe there is dedicated option for creating snupkg with it. `nuget pack -symbols -version 1.0.0  -SymbolPackageFormat snupkg`, but same option doesn't exist for for `dotnet nuget pack` and we have to pass as property for msbuild.
`dotnet pack --include-symbols /p:version=1.1.0,symbolpackageformat=snupkg -o ./`
I believe we should have dedicated option same option for `dotnet nuget` as feature completeness for `nuget` vs `dotnet nuget`

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Error message for dotnet nuget push with apikey from another machine need improvement" (#11844) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

n/a

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

If you create apikeys with "nuget setapikey xxxxx -source somesource" then it creates <apikeys> section in nuget.config.
If you copy whole repo including nuget.config into another machine, then try push nupkg then it gives me `error: Key not valid for use in specified state.`
It's not helpful, it should give us better message.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
